background.para: Sindarin begin the game much older than human characters, generally in the region of 50 to 150 years. Older Sindarin are possible, but it's difficult to rationalise a Sindarin of this age being of 'beginning character' capability.

The Sindarin character's age should be chosen by the player, and it has no effect on the number of skill points gained. Sindarin are a fickle lot, and how much a Sindarin has learnt is as much a factor of their mood for the last few decades, as it is of their age.

Sindarin player characters have a further 20 experience points to place on skills on their choice. If they wish to buy further experience with advantages, this is possible. Sindarin characters start with a lot of skills, though not much flexibility.
Khuzdul player characters will start the game somewhere between 50 and 100 years of age. Khuzdul live well into their third century, sometimes longer, so this is considered to be a young adult.

Characters get a further 20 experience points to spend on other skills. There is no modification of experience for age. Khuzdul characters may buy extra experience with advantages, at the normal rates.
